page.title: 04Niton Undercliff-Ecology
page.content: The Undercliff used to consist mainly of grazing land,and for hundreds of years there seems to have been very few trees,but much low scrub,until in the 1790's the Arnolds of Mirables planted an orchard and other trees; in the 1820's the Willoughby Gordons of The Orchard also planted extensive- ly.Oaks,Holm Oaks and Scyamore are now colonising,but the recent loss of Elm trees has greatly reduced the wood- land.Regrettably much of the open land has now been built over.The drystone walls which border the Undercliff Road and many of the fields,are now almost the last remaining in the Island;un- fortunately they do not stand up well to the vibration of the increasingly heavy traffic, and they were also badly damaged during the last war by tanks and other vehicles.
